name: Theme Songs for Kids  Quiz | TV for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: "Who lives in a pineapple under the sea?"
questions.explanation:
SpongeBob SquarePants.

	"SpongeBob SqaurePants" first aired in 1999. In the first episode of the show, SpongeBob applied to work at the Krusty Krab and got the job after filling orders for a large dinner rush.

questions.text:
"Be careful not to mess with the balance of things 
Because everything is not ... what it seems"
questions.explanation:
Wizards of Waverly Place.

	This Disney Channel show ran from 2007 to 2012. It featured a family of wizards all competing to become the family wizard. The family was brought back for one movie in 2013 called "Alex vs. Alex".

questions.text:
"And stuck itself upon his wrist with secrets that it hid
Now he's got super powers, he's no ordinary kid"
questions.explanation:
Ben 10.

	"Ben 10" was a kid who could transform into an alien to fight villains. The original show ended in 2008 and led to spin off shows such as "Ben 10: Ultimate Alien".

questions.text:
"Come along with me
Let's head out to sea
What this world has for you and for me now"
options: The Suite Life of Zack and Cody
questions.explanation:
The Suite Life On Deck.

	"The Suite Life on Deck" was a spin off of "The Suite Life of Zack and Cody". On this show Zack, Cody, and London Tipton attended a semester at sea aboard the SS Tipton.

questions.text:
"Live life, breathe air
I know somehow we're gonna get there
And feel so wonderful"
questions.explanation:
iCarly.

	iCarly ran from 2007 to 2012. The show was about a girl named Carly who, with the help of her friends Sam and Freddy, created a weekly web show.

questions.text:
"You take the moon 
And you take the sun 
You take everything that sounds like fun."
questions.explanation:
Chowder.

	Chowder ran from 2007 to 2010. The show followed Chowder's strange adventures as he worked as an apprentice to Mung Daal to become a famous chef.

questions.text:
"Timmy is an average kid, 
That no one understands, 
Mom and Dad and Vicky always giving him commands."
questions.explanation:
The Fairly OddParents.

	"The Fairly OddParents" premiered in 2006 and is about a boy name Timmy who is granted two fairy godparents. Together, Cosmo and Wanda try to teach Timmy to use their magic responsibly as well as protect him from babysitter Vicky.

questions.text:
"Today's all burnt toast
Running late and dad jokes
Has anybody seen my left shoe?"
questions.explanation:
Good Luck Charlie.

	"Good Luck Charlie" aired for four years and ended in 2014. In this show Teddy keeps a video diary to help her little sister, Charlie, with life when she grows up.

questions.text:
"There's 104 days of summer vacation
And school comes along just to end it
So the annual problem for our generation
Is finding a good way to spend it."
questions.explanation:
Phineas and Ferb.

	In this show the main characters, Phineas and Ferb, spent each day working on a new task or project. Their sister Candace would try to report the boys to their mom, but by the end of the day all traces of their adventures would mysteriously vanish.

questions.text:
"Every birthday, my mom and dad would say
You're another year older, another year wiser
But I still go to school to get an education."
questions.explanation:
Rugrats All Grown Up.

	"Rugrats All Grown Up" was a spin off of the original "Rugrats" show that followed the characters during their teenage years. The show lasted from 2003 to 2008.
